author: Sue Frause
title: Katharine Ross and Sam Elliott to receive awards at Friday Harbor Film Festival
text:
Photo courtesy Friday Harbor Film Festival Actors Katherine Ross and Sam Elliott will be presented awards during the third annual Friday Harbor Film Festival on San Juan Island . The three-day festival runs November 6-8, 2015 and features Stories of the Pacific Rim and Beyond . The 2015 lineup continues the momentum of the two previous film festivals , and features documentaries "meant to tell important stories" of the Pacific Ocean and the Pacific Rim. The films focus on culture, marine ecology, environmental issues, adventure and people who live and work near the world's largest ocean. This year's festival features 32 feature films and 12 short films exploring the following themes:
Explorers and Adventures Local Heroes Tales From the Heart Things to Consider Short Films - Art & Artists Among the feature films are:
Chihuly Fire & Light - Follows glass artist Dale Chihuly as he conceives and creates an extraordinary exhibition of his work Unbranded - A real life-life adventure that makes the case for better land and wild horse management Dancing with Thoreau: Environmental film told from the perspective of a naturalist and organic farmer The films will be shown in five venues, all within easy walking distance of the ferry terminal in Friday Harbor . Park your car in Anacortes and walk on the Washington State Ferries to San Juan Island , allowing time to explore historic Friday Harbor's galleries, museums and shops and dine at the town's local restaurants.
During the festival's Opening Night Gala at the San Juan Community Theatre on November 6, actors Katharine Ross (who will be present to receive the award) and Sam Elliott will be presented with the Andrew V. McLaglen Lifetime Achievement Award. The award celebrates their outstanding careers in film and television.
Andrew Victor McLaglen was a film and television director. He was born in London in 1920, but lived and worked in the United States for most of his life. McLaglen directed 95 episodes of Gunsmoke and 116 episodes of Have Gun - Will Travel . Among his big screen directing credits are major western and action films starring John Wayne and James Stewart, including McClintock, Shenandoah, Cahill US Marshall and the Wild Geese . His final film was Return from the River Kwai in 1989. Mr. McLaglen passed away at his home on San Juan Island in 2014, where he had lived since the 1970s. While on the island, he directed numerous productions for San Juan Community Theatre. There will be a screening of an 18-minute biographical film produced by his friend and filmmaker Laszlo Pal at the Opening Night Gala on November 6.
